FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 1
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
Garden and Orchard Insects, Dept, of Entomology.
Music.
Need for Financial Agreement, Irma H. Gross,
Div. of Home Economics.
Michigan State College of the Air—Survey of
English Literature, E. P. Lawrence, Dept, of
English.
Music—Alpha Epsilon Mu, Music Fraternity.
Adventures Abroad—The Red Square and Lenin’s
Tomb in Russia, E. B. Hill, Dept, of Farm Man¬
agement.
Spartan Sports in Review, Harry Wismer.
SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 2
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
4-H Club Program — Activities of the Campus
4-H Club, John Krauss, 4-H News.
Football—Temple University vs. Michigan State
College.
MONDAY, NOVEMBER 4
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
The Pros and Cons of Fall Plowing, C. E. Millar,
Dept, of Soils.
Rural Electrification, L. A. Walkling, Sec’y, Mich¬
igan Rural Electrification Ass’n.
Music—Julius Stulberg, Violin, Joe Evans, Piano.
The Health of the Farm Woman I, Div. of Home
Economics.
Michigan State College of the Air—Psychology No.
4, J. M. DeHaan, Dept, of Psychology.
Music.
Growing Up in the Family — The Challenge of
Good Fellowship, Mrs. Lydia Lynde, Extension
Specialist in Child Development.
News of the Highways, Mott Heath, Michigan
State Highway Dept.
TUESDAY, NOVEMBER, 5
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A.
Current Poultry Problems, F. N. Barrett, Dept,
of Poultry Husbandry.
Music—Robert Coleman, Piano.
Spray Residue Program, W. C. Geagley, Michi¬
gan State Dept, of Agriculture.
Michigan State College of the Air—Survey of
English Literature, E. P. Lawrence, Dept, of
English.
Michigan High School Debate Clinic—Debate:
Resolved—That the several nations should make
government monopolies of the manufacture and
sale of all combat instruments of war, Uni¬
versity of Detroit vs. Michigan State College.
Round table discussion led by Harold Schell,
East Lansing High School.
WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 6
Weather and Market Reports.
Farm Flash, U. S. D. A. .
Current Questions and Answers, Dept, of Agri¬
cultural Engineering.
Music—WKAR Trio. .
Fall Fashions in Hats and Accessories, Marion
Hillhouse, Div. of Home Economics.
Michigan State College of the Air—Spanish Les¬
son No. 5, J. O. Swain, Dept, of Modern Lan¬
guages.
Music, Wendell Westcott, Piano.
Michigan State College of the Air—Dramatic
Production, C. H. Nickle, Dept, of Speech and
Dramatics.
Geography in the News, E. C. Prophet, Dept, of
Geology and Geography.
